name: Crisp-Top Sourdough Stuffing
description: Although it's nearly as quick to make as boxed stuffing, this homemade version--soft in the middle and a little crunchy on the top--is prettier and certainly tastier.
recipeIngredient: 1 1-pound loaf sourdough, at least 1 day old
About 3 cups turkey broth, reduced-sodium chicken broth, or mushroom or other vegetable broth

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Slice bread into 1 1/2-in.-thick slices and tear into irregular 1- to 2-in. pieces. Spread on a rimmed baking sheet and leave to dry at room temperature until needed (up to 2 days). For the best stuffing, the bread should be very dry.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. Melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Pour out 2 tbsp. butter and set aside.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Add onion, celery, herbs, and 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper to hot pan. Cook until onions are translucent and celery is tender-crisp, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Add torn bread and broth to vegetables and mix in until bread is soaked. Add salt and pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Generously coat a 9- by 13-in. glass baking pan with 1 tsp. reserved melted butter. Pour stuffing into pan and drizzle with remaining melted butter.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Cover with foil; bake 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake until starting to brown on top, about 30 minutes more.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
recipeInstructions.text: Make ahead: Up to 2 days, chilled. Reheat at 350°, covered, until hot (about 30 minutes). Remove foil and cook 10 more minutes for a crunchy top layer.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
recipeInstructions.text: Crisp-Top Sourdough Stuffing with Sausage and Greens: Add 8 oz. sautéed crumbled Italian -sausage and 1 lb. briefly sautéed fresh spinach leaves to stuffing before baking.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
recipeInstructions.text: Scandinavian Stuffing: Replace sourdough with a 1-lb. loaf of crusty rye bread, then add 1 cup chopped fresh dill and 8 oz. diced smoked pork chops to stuffing before baking. Top with 2 tbsp. fresh dill sprigs before serving.
